basics.name: Nick Klauer
basics.label: SOA Middleware Administrator, Developer
basics.summary: Solving problems with software and a lot of common sense

highlights: Responsible for maintaining 16+ Oracle Fusion Middleware (FMW) clusters

Develop tooling and applications to control, patch, deploy, and maintain various infrastructure products related to FMW systems, such as Oracle Service Bus (OSB), Oracle SOA Suite (SOA), Business Transaction Management (BTM), and Oracle Enterprise Manager - Cloud Control (OEMCC)
Maintained and developed trading software and features that were responsible for trading $2B+ annually in Megawatt-Hours (MWh) of electricity.
Developed solution to reduce risk of base-load forecasting by $10,000 / day of missed or incorrectly calculated demand.
Team Leader responsibilities include inventory, supply, logistics operations

Team Lead for the companyâ€™s intelligence operations during Afghanistan Deployment from May through December 2013.  Responsible for planning route operations, investigating intelligence reports, reporting all company movements and intelligence observations to higher command, and prepared daily and weekly briefs.  Ancillary skill position acquired several months prior to deployment as additional duty

work.position: IT Analyst I - Enterprise Application Integration (EAI)
highlights: Software developer for software integrations connecting various software products together with employee, financial, security, and supply chain data.
Developed 30+ integrations using database queries, SOAP-based web services, and extensive use of message-based systems.
Lead multiple teams in physical training activities.
Mentored subordinate Marines in career planning, both for the military path as well as civilian career opportunities.
Deployed to Iraq as part of Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) in 2006.

volunteer.summary: Lateral transfer to the Human Relations-side of the Marines, I was primarily involved in writing memorandums, preparing documentation for submittal, and assisted in training several hundred Marines to deploy to Iraq
Served in 1st Regiment, 14th Marine Battalion, Charlie Battery.  Deployed to Iraq in 2005-2006 in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom as a convoy escort assitant under 3/14 Hotel Battery

awards.title: Army Commendation Medal - 3rd Award
awards.summary: Awarded for running the company's intelligence team and coordinating over 30 convoy operations.  Prepared daily and weekly intelligence briefings at company and battalion levels regarding current and potential threats in the area.

awards.title: Afghanistan Campaign Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for serving in Operation Enduring Freedom in 2013.

awards.title: Certificate of Commendation - 3rd Award
awards.summary: Awarded for organizing and leading a training effort for over 300 Marines and Sailors as part of pre-deployment training.

awards.title: Iraq Campaign Medal
awards.summary: Awarded for deployment to Iraq in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) in 2006.

interests.name: Family
interests.summary: I have a wife and 4 boys under the age of 10.  Life is exciting.

interests.name: Go (Golang)
interests.summary: I have been coding Go for the past 6 months.  It's an interesting language, which I'm attracted to for it's cross-platform deployment ease.
